page.title: 05THE FARMER & OUR CLIMATE
page.content: { Type of Land-}The land is fairly flat and this is a help because there isn't much problem with drainage . The soil is mainly clay which is good for cereals. {Wind-}The east winds we get are sometimes a hindrance especially when the farmer wants to go spraying or fertilising .It is also a hindrance at harvest time when the wind can shake the heads offthe barley and wheat.In one year,the farmer can lose quarter of his crop because of the wind.In the winter snows the wind drives it into drifts against the hedges. {Rainfall-}Our rainfall here is 22.5 inches averaged over the last 10 years.This is classed as semi-desert on rainfall charts. It isn't enough. {Sunshine-}In summer we average 210 hrs of sunshine a month. This is about 8 hrs a day & it helps ripen the wheat.
